description.narrative: The development objective aim was for companies, directors, managers, workers, consumers, and suppliers to be mobilised to pursue values of transparency, integrity, and zero tolerance to corruption by adhering to the Business Integrity Pact Against Corruption (BIPAC). The Pact contained a set of relevant guidelines and principles on corporate governance and code of conduct that companies should adhere to within their operations and promote upstream and downstream within their industries. The intervention logic rested on building a business coalition against corruption by raising awareness, advocating, training, and mobilising companies to adhere to the principles behind the BIPAC in order to create a peer pressure dynamic to mobilise change.

Insatsen avser stöd till den lokala näringslivsföreningen Instituto de Directores de Mozambique (IOD) som förespråkar integritet, anti-korruption och ökat socialt ansvar inom näringslivet i Mozambique. Ambassaden föreslår stödja organisationens arbete kring korruption och syftet med insatsen är att bygga en koalition av företag som åtar sig att öka transparens och arbeta aktivt mot korruption genom ökad medvetenhet inom företagen, bättre bolagstyrning och en noll-tolerans policy mot korruption. Sveriges stöd kommer finansiera bakgrundsanalys av korruptionsproblematiken i Mozambique från ett näringslivsperspektiv, utveckling av ett dokument med principer och vägledning för företag som ansluter sig till koalitionen samt kapacitetsuppbygnad och kampanjer för att öka förståelse och medvetenhet av de negativa effekterna av korruption för privatsektorutveckling och för landets utveckling. Riskerna bedöms vara låga till medel och i de riksåtgärd som föreslås ingår att upphandla konsultjänster för stöd och uppföljning inom intern styrning och kontroll, finansiering av dessa tjänster bokförs på insatsen och ingår i budgeten.
The intervention aims to support the business association Instituto de Directores to Mozambique to work towards increased awareness of and comittment to anti-corruption in the private sector.

tag.narrative: 16.5 - Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms.
16.5 - Väsentligt minska alla former av korruption och mutor.

description.narrative: Key contribution objectives The IOD have identified indicators as sub-objectives to reaching the objectives of the contributions. With the exception of the target for the number of companies signing the BIPAC, IOD does not set numerical targets to concretise the indicators. Objective 1. Companies are mobilized to pursue values such as transparency,integrity, probity, and zero tolerance to corruption by signing andimplementing the Business Integrity Pact Against Corruption Indicator 1: Number of private companies signing the principles advocated by the BIPAC in Mozambique Target: 75 SME signatories to BIPAC by the end of 2015 Results: 75 (of which 25 were SME:s) Indicator 2: Number of public enterprises signing the principles advocated by the BIPAC in Mozambique.Results: 5 public enterprises. Objective 2. Private and public companies have increased awareness and have beentrained on BIPAC principles Indicator 1: Advocacy and training events carried out at the national levelResults: 5 (2 in 2015 and 3 in 2016) Indicator 2: Number of companies attending the advocacy and training eventResults: 300 (100 in 2015 and 200 in 2016) Objective 3. Analysis of legal framework and local context has been completed as abasis for development of BIPAC document Indicator 1: Completed study Results: One (1) completed study Objective 4. Seminar on BIPAC initiative to discuss first draft and final draft ofBIPAC document Indicator 1: Launch seminarResults: One (1) seminar held in 2014 Indicator 2: Follow-up seminarResults: One (1) follow-up seminar held in 2015
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
